Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory204.png'}
{3: 'You have an appointment to meet Noan this afternoon in Constellia.'}
{3: "You show up early at the scheduled spot, but he's nowhere to be found. You figure you'll kill some time at the bar next door—and end up spotting him there."}
{3: 'He\'s surrounded by a bunch of Cargo Crew members who are all swearing under their breath. The table is covered with playing cards and dice, and there\'s a pile of "loot" stacked around him.'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Cargo Crew Member A', 3: "Come on, let's go again! I've never seen anyone stay this ******* lucky playing against me. Didn't think some Construct from Babylonia would be pulling off card tricks!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan', 3: "I can't right now. I can play again tomorrow, but I've got an appointment coming up.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'RImgBg1Shake'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cargo Crew Member A', 3: "So you strut around like you're hot stuff and then try to bail? The **** you have an appointment.", 4: '1'}
{3: "The group looks ready to explode with anger, but they can't do a thing against the Construct, so they just slam the table and hurl insults."}
{2: 'Sorry, but he really has one right now. Could you come back another time?', 3: '16'}
{2: 'Cargo Crew Member A', 3: "Aren't you guys wanna f******...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cargo Crew Member B', 3: 'Hey, boss...', 4: '2'}
{3: "He grabs his teammate's arm and gestures toward Noan, who keeps his head lowered over the card table and has his hand on his Rev Blade."}
{2: 'Cargo Crew Member A', 3: "I'll let you off this time!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan', 3: "...Why'd you get here so early?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Am I bothering you?', 3: '28'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "No, it's just a little chaotic here.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'You look at the scattered playing cards on the table and remember how Noan always seems incredibly lucky at games like this...'}
{2: "Well, since I'm not bothering you, why don't you join me for a round?", 3: '31'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Sure. Should we go with that simple "guess higher or lower" game we tried before? We\'ll take turns guessing, and whoever messes up first loses.', 4: '1'}

{3: 'With a smile, Noan picks up the deck. Like last time, he only keeps the heart suit. After a quick shuffle, he places the pile in the middle, draws the top card, and flips it over—revealing the smallest heart: the Ace.'}
{2: 'I can only guess high for the next card.', 3: '36'}
{3: 'Noan nods, then draws a new card—the Seven of Hearts.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Hmm... I'll guess high too.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Following the sequence, the next card is the Three of Hearts.'}
{3: 'Noan smiles calmly and sets the card on the table. If he weren\'t sitting right in the middle of all his "spoils," this scene would look pretty convincing.'}
{2: "Noan, what's the next card after the Three of Hearts?", 3: '44'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "I don't know.", 4: '1'}
{2: "You think I'd believe that?", 3: '47'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "If you're talking about what you saw when you walked in... they were cheating at the table, and I just decided to play along with them.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "But with you, it's just a normal game. No need to prep anything in advance.", 4: '1'}
{3: "If that's really how it is, he wouldn't be losing so fast. Then again, knowing him, even if you press further, he'll probably change the subject."}
{2: "Let's switch things up. If you guess the next card correctly, I'll grant you one request.", 3: '51'}
{3: "He places a hefty stack of chips on the table and flashes the remaining deck at Noan. After a moment's silence, he sighs, and then smiles like he's just hatched a plan."}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "For real? You're not gonna regret this?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Totally serious. Anything you want.', 3: '56', 4: 'Just... keep it within reason, okay?', 5: '56'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Alright then... it's the Seven of Hearts.", 4: '1'}
{3: "You glance at the card hidden in your hand, and sure enough, it's the Seven of Hearts."}
{3: "For the next draw, he doesn't go in order but picks one straight from the middle. He tilts his head for a moment, then calls out the right answer again."}
{2: "That's correct again. Do these cards have some kind of marking on them?", 3: '61'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Markings are definitely an option, but this deck doesn't have any. I used a false shuffle.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Noan', 3: "This trick makes it look like I'm shuffling, but it doesn't actually change the order of the cards. As long as I keep track of the original sequence, I can always tell what the next one will be.", 4: '1'}
{2: "What've you been learning lately...?", 3: '64'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'My teacher showed me this ages ago. This kind of game helps you fit right in and get everyone talking.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Alright, fair's fair. I lost the bet—so what's your request?", 3: '66'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "I really want to chat with you more. How about we make our date last a little longer? We'll see the movie we planned, then grab dinner afterward.", 4: '1'}
{2: "That's it? I was planning to spend the rest of the day with you anyway.", 3: '69', 4: "Sure, let's head out.", 5: '77'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{3: 'Noan steps forward and gently covers your eyes with his hand.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Commandant, please close your eyes.'}
{1: 'AniZhuanchangBegin'}
